page.title: 06Recreation Survey
page.content: A survey of spare-time summer activites was carried out among 25 boys and 25 girls aged between 7 and 11 years at Clifton Without Junior School, York during July 1985.It was discovered that the most popular school play-time activity for boys was football.64% of the boys played soccer and 24% liked playing marbles.After school 32% played football and 32% played on their bicycles.Others liked tennis,swimming and marbles.48% of the girls played organised chasing games in the playground and 28% just talked. After school 88% of the girls just "played out." 44% of the girls said they played with boys but only 4% of the boys admitted to mixed games. The school has no field or swimming lessons and both boys and girls wanted more playtime facilities such as a football pitch, swings and a pool.
